attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action: Make Bullying illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Children are being permanently damaged but the affect of bullying it is morally wrong we as the people should be more vigilant in protecting our youth from the pain and forever damage bullying causes bullying needs to be illegal in all of its area from the simple name calling to the abuse
attributes.additional_details:
a on going debate on whether it should be illegal http://www.debate.org/opinions/should-bullying-be-illegal

http://www.teenink.com/opinion/school_college/article/331577/Should-There-Be-a-Law-Against-Bullying/

attributes.action: Ban Fixed Odds Betting Terminals
attributes.background:
Following the Gambling Act of 2005, Fixed Odds Betting Terminals are a feature in bookmakers' shops on our high streets.
Government should  give Councils powers to ban them from the high street
attributes.additional_details:
FOBTs are called the "crack cocaine" of gambling.
Users can lose hundreds of pounds in only a few minutes and can turn violent when this happens.
FOBTs destroy lives and families.
Government should act to ban them from our high streets.

attributes.action: Government to take full admittance on the 'tainted blood scandal' & an apology.
attributes.background: The "Tainted Blood Scandal" is the event of nearly 5,000 people being infected with the Hepatitis C and 1,200 being infected with HIV, often during treatment for Haemophilia or Blood Transfusion by the NHS in the 1970s and 1980s and the subsequent government reaction.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite numerous calls from campaigners, victims and MP's over the years, successive governments in Westminster have refused to hold a Public Inquiry into the matter.

To date no government, health or pharmaceutical entity in the UK has admitted liability for the scandal and no compensation has been paid to those infected or affected. Compensation has been paid in Ireland.

attributes.action: Make all anti-depressants free on the NHS
attributes.background: Anti-depressant tablets are needed by a large proportion of the U.K population - why should people have to pay for these when they desperately need them. Mental illnesses should be treated the same way as physical: in the way that for example Thyroid tablets are free, anti-depressants should be.

attributes.action: BRING BACK DEATH PENALTY FOR TERROISM AND TREASON
attributes.background:
bring back the death penalty for terroism acts against the united kingdom 
also bring back the death penalty on anyone who commits treason this should be anyone who tries to burn the flag tries to turn people against the united kingdom and  cause hatred

attributes.action: Reverse the agreement for the MOD to purchse helicopters from the USA
attributes.background: The UK helicopter manufacturers have a fantastic track record and in the present economic uncertainty of the UK it would be wrong to award the new fleet to US manufacturers.  The UK has proved over many many years that they could fulfil the MODs requirements.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from political control. HM Government to set NHS budgets only.
attributes.background: The NHS should be run by a board of governors who are accountable to Parliament, like the BBC, with sensible targets, acceptable staffing levels and long-term plans. Politicians could then honestly debate the real issue, FUNDING, allowing a clear choice between parties which would interest voters.
attributes.additional_details: Constant reorganisation by politicians has damaged the NHS: it is divisive and saps energy, focus and productivity; there has been little time for benefits to show. Some change has been driven by political ideology from both sides without much clinical benefit. Governments only look 5 years ahead, until the next election. A quick fix for 5 years is no good. An independent but accountable, properly managed NHS would use research and sound experience to make plans for us all for the long term.

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs overtaking restrict to inside lane only motorways dual carriageways
attributes.background: Lorries that overtake can sometimes take 2-5 miles to do so and should all be restricted to roughly the same maximum speed, I Believe that all HGVs should be banned from overtaking and be restricted to use if the inside lane only (except if Turing right dual carriageways )
attributes.additional_details: I'm sure we have all spent miles behind a lorry creeping past another whilst blocking a huge queue of cars and vehicles who are clearly faster moving only for the lorry to after an age pull back in front of the other lorry it's absolutely pointless and dangerous and costs money in water time for others and builds anger and frustration in all concerned

attributes.action: Pursue a tariff free trade deal and free movement of people deal with the USA
attributes.background: We have been allies for a long time and we would highly complement each other to be able to trade and move freely for purposes of work and or family reuniting purposes, students should still be under student visas however!
attributes.additional_details: My own example is my wife and I married over in the USA 15/04/2011 due to unrealistic income requirement have been apart for 5 years of our marriage we have had just 9 months together 3 in USA and 6 in the UK, she has vast experience in care and in hotel management and retail so could get a job here, I am easily able to gain work there as a PSV driver and HGV and or in gaining EMT state certification there to gain employment! Both of us would have to file taxes in our own countries even if zero!

attributes.action: Bring back retrospective death penalty for murderers and paedophiles
attributes.background: I am a British citizen. And am fed up with the way we have to pay for scumbags to "enjoy their captivity"

attributes.action: Pass legislation to restrict betting on referenda and general elections.
attributes.background: Shortly before the EU Referendum, bookmakers' odds for Remain were 1/4, while those for Leave were 5/1. Such odds have the potential to influence voting, irrespective of the political issues at stake. It is reported that 69 per cent of individual bets were placed on Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference: Financial Times dated 26 June 2016
"Brexit wagers set new record for non-sports bets" by Paul McClean.

attributes.action: Make vet check-ups and treatments free.
attributes.background: Many poor families have pets, and if that pet gets into a fight, they might not have the money to pay for treatment.

attributes.action: A public enquiry to review why people voted as they did in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
It too easy for politicians just to say referendum complete, democracy has been served. Public opinion must be present throughout the whole process, to ensure we receive a democratic outcome. 

This is a massive decision in the country's history we should find out the facts before we progress.
attributes.additional_details:
UK decision makers must be armed with infomation which details the reasons why the UK electorate voted as they did. Enabling these decision makers to formulate the next steps in a way which is in line with public opinion.

Lies have been told on both sides.

People seem to have been unaware of possible economic consequences.

Decisions have been revaluated.

Votes may have been cast as a protest against the UK government.

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: Set the voting age for referendums to 16
attributes.background:
Referendums cover issues with a long term effect. 

Very often a 16 year old at voting time will be 18 when the decision comes into force
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland the voting age for many elections is already 16.

It is not logical to deprive these people of the vote for referendums.

A next step should be to make the voting age for referendums 16 throughout the UK

attributes.action: Make Friday a Half working day
attributes.background: Gives everyone a longer weekend. People will be happier and less stressed.

attributes.action: Debate the rich poor divide, media bias and its effects on fear of immigration
attributes.background: We want parliament to move debates beyond the fear of migration and what to do about it. To the socio-economic background within which this fear is being nurtured and what to do about that. Including media coverage of the topic, tax avoidance-depriving the UK of revenue & the growing rich/ poor gap.
attributes.additional_details: Open and forward thinking discussion is urgently needed to re-dress the in balance of the economics of globalisation, money markets and the effects of private lobbying within Westminster by big business and private individuals. Trickle down is not working and wealth is pooling upwards instead. Leaving fewer resources for ever greater numbers of people world wide. I believe this is a root cause for the current fear of immigration in the UK which is being fuelled by facets of invested media.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties

attributes.action: Referendum on income tax
attributes.background:
Holding a referendum has proven to be an effective and democratic way to decide the nation's future in matters of highest importance.
We therefore propose to hold a referendum to decide to abolish the income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the tax payers have paid a weekly amount of £3.1billion in
income tax across all bands. We propose to abolish such mandatory
payment to the state, and instead to take back control of this money
and fund the NHS with an additional £3.1billion per week.
In order to comply with the rules of democracy we suggest that no less than the majority (i.e. 23,299,988 people) of eligible voters must be in favour. We can entrust the voters to make the right decision for
the Country.

attributes.action: Investigate UK areas of deep social dislocation and propose remedial measures
attributes.background: The result of the EU Referendum on 23 June revealed significant differences between different parts of the UK. Polls also revealed sharply constrasting social circumstances and motivations for the different votes. There appears to be a causative correlation between vote and social circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
The poll conducted by Lord Ashcroft shows significant social, educational and age differences between the two sides of the EU Referendum votes: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/
The differences in the voting in different parts of the country are readily available.

attributes.action: Until Brexit Article 50 details are agreed, plans for HS2 should be put on hold.
attributes.background: The UK is undergoing considerable economic and financial strain. As this situation will continue, at least, until such time as all the EU severance details (Article 50) are worked through, the UK Government should put an immediate stop and hold on any further development of the HS2 project.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: Ban tenant renewal fees
attributes.background: Why should we, the tenants, or even the landlords, have to pay out an extreme amount of money just for estate agents to print out the exact same paper as they did before, with just a couple of numbers changed? I SAY NO!
attributes.additional_details:
This world is hard enough you love in with all the prices on rent, bill, shopping etc, increasing all the time.
Estate agents make enough money from us.
It's extortionate for them to request more money for then to do absolutely nothing other than print out a bit of paper.
Anyone can do this.

That money being requested could go towards a lot of things you need.
DON'T let them keep doing this to you.
DON'T let them rip you off!!
Sign now, and let's fight back to take what is OURS!!

attributes.action: Don't scrap the right to buy on uk council homes
attributes.background:
Don't  scrap  the right to buy scheme for uk council homes 


The right to buy  is the only way most people will ever get on the housing ladder

attributes.action: Discuss a National Coalition government after the EU referendum result
attributes.background: Britain exiting the EU is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. Unity is required and there are concerns of a rise in too far to the right politics.
attributes.additional_details: Exiting Europe is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. A rise in racism and contempt has been reported by immigrants and by people of a minority ethnicity and I feel the British people need reassurances that the goverment won't be led too far right. A Tory lead coalition government with Labour and SNP should be discussed. I feel the coalition will offer stability and offer the best negotiations for the British people when exiting the EU.

attributes.action: Ban gender-specific uniform policies
attributes.background:
Equality movements started being effective in the 1960's, yet we haven't seen modern equality spread to school uniform policy. 
Nobody should be expected to dress a certain way purely because of the way they were born. 
This would also help fight abuse towards transgender schoolchildren.

attributes.action: Ensure the police can protect minority groups while the Brexit talks take place
attributes.background: In light of the recent increase in racist attacks in the immediate aftermath of the Brexit vote, we call on the government to condemn these attacks in the strongest language and ensure that the police have the resources to protect all our minority populations during the Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Ensure that all bureaucrats involved in EU exit talks are elected non-experts
attributes.background:
The British people have demonstrated their desire to free themselves from government by unelected bureaucrats and so-called experts.
The will of the people must be respected: all those involved in EU exit negotiations should have no expertise and should be elected directly to the role.
attributes.additional_details:
Much of the campaign to leave the EU focused on our lives being run by unelected bureaucrats and the 'misinformation' provided by experts. The massive 3.8% majority for leave in the referendum is a clear mandate to end the negative influence of unelected bureaucrats and experts.
Anyone involved in EU exit talks should be directly elected. Given the timeframe of the negotiations, their terms of office should be for 8 months, allowing us to assess their performance and get rid of them if need be.

attributes.action: 2nd referendum for 16-50 year olds
attributes.background: Almost two thirds of over 60s voted in favour of Brexit and those under 49 voted to remain (according to advance polling). Three quarters of people aged 18-24 voted to remain. It is not fair that the older generation have dominated a large percentage of votes and decided the future for the young.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from Buzzfeed article: https://www.buzzfeed.com/patricksmith/young-people-are-angry-at-old-people-for-voting-leave?utm_term=.eo43KzXBMe#.eo43KzXBMe

attributes.action: Mandatory and timely parliamentary debates for petitions with 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: Currently, petitions that reach 100,000 signatures do not require parliamentary debates. This is an inadequate and undemocratic response. Concerns expressed by large numbers of citizens, should invoke mandatory, timely parliamentary debates

attributes.action: During referendums all politicians swear before a judge to tell the whole truth
attributes.background: the public should be able to take demonstratable factual evidence from politicians on important subjects usually called in referendums. The politicians should clearly state what are facts and what is speculation & as in a court should be asked to swear an oath which supports this.
attributes.additional_details: The 2016 EU referendum on either was clearly not based on a facts or truths. This has the potential for causing great harm.

attributes.action: Introduce a complaints commission that holds the UK press truly accountable
attributes.background: We petition to replace IPSO with a regulator that actually holds the UK press to account (similar to ofcom), and take measures such as not allowing a complete bias, active investigation of misleading headlines and apologies on the same scale as the original article. Regulation should be mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: The recent referendum campaign was an example of the how toxic the UK press have become and how well they are misinforming the UK public for ulterior motives. The fact that Rupert Murdoch can use the UK press to the to fulfill his own anti-EU agenda and at the same time maintain a friendship with our prime minister shows just how corrupt the whole system is.  To abide with IPSO is not even mandatory, and the more impartial press outlets refuse to be part of it out of protest of its uselessness.

attributes.action: Declare EU referendum void as 16 & 17 year olds were denied the vote
attributes.background: The EU referendum is a significant constitutional event.  It will affect the rights and opportunities of all UK citizens for many years to come. The 16 & 17 year old should have been given a vote. The precedent for this already having been established for the recent Scottish Independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The size of the youth vote is large enough to have had a material effect on the outcome of the election

attributes.action: Give the right to children to argue their case in schools
attributes.background: In schools, teachers have complete over-riding control over what children say. If they are falsely accused of doing something which they believe they have not done, or they do not believe they do not deserve a certain punishment, it is labelled as "talking back."
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition to allow children to be able to freely argue their case with a neutral member of staff present in order to make sure that they receive a fair sanction. I have witnessed cases of children not being listened to and having to email the teacher to be heard. Sign for your child's rights.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK's policy on the EU with options for different plans.
attributes.background:
A referendum not grouping policies on what we should do about the EU so the decision isn't made without asking the people.

Suggested options -

Remain in the EU
Leave but remain in the EEA
Leave the EU & EEA, keeping trade agreements 
Leave all EU agreements
attributes.additional_details:
After the July referendum MPs are now discussing what we should do and when we should do it. 

This is because the options weren't clear enough and it is in the interests of democracy to ask the population how they want to deal with Europe with regards to the key issues of membership, economy, trade and immigration.

In short, as we currently have no public consensus on a plan, we are currently set to have a new Prime Minister elected only by Tory Party members choose what we do.

attributes.action: To have the 23rd June declared an official day of mourning.
attributes.background: To demonstrate to the people who voted us out of the European Union, that we do not consider the 23rd June a cause for celebration.
attributes.additional_details: To be taken out of the European Union is an extremely serious step with catastrophic consequences and there are at least 16 million people who agree with me.  We are not going to be forced to make this move without some form of protest at the least.

attributes.action: To form a UK sterling trade area
attributes.background:
The formation of a sterling trade area comprising England and Wales, an independent Scotland and a united Ireland has the 
 potential to resolve almost all issues of sovereignty, currency, trade agreements following the Brexit decision

attributes.action: Post-Brexit breakup reunion with Scotland to re-join EU
attributes.background: Should the UK break up after leaveing the EU, following the EU Referendum result, we the undersigned call upon HM Government to consider uniting with an independent Scotland, thus allowing a re-entry into the EU under a Scottish alliance.

attributes.action: Allow the Black Country to seperate from the union, and ignore laws of London.
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum, it has been suggested that the city of London break away from the Union. 
To save any hassle, we suggest that the Black Country break away from the rule of London, and set up our own system of government and law, as London wants nothing to do with the nation.

attributes.action: EU nationals contributing to UK economy for at least 15 years to get citizenship
attributes.background: Following the referendum EU nationals who have made their lives in the UK,  who contribute to society by working and paying taxes are worried about their future. No one knows what the negotiations will bring. The proposal is for EU nationals in the UK for at least 15 years to gain Citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Being a contributing factor to the economy of the UK for this average length of time proves dedication to be part of the UK society and culture. EU nationals who have built their lives in the UK, are at risk of facing visa/work restrictions. Citizenship or indefinite right to remain for the contributors.

attributes.action: Restore the historic boundary of Warwickshire.
attributes.background:
In 1974 the county of Warwickshire was broken up to make the fictitious region of West Midlands.
The local government act 1972 change Warwickshire's boundaries and took out the major cities.
Birmingham, Coventry, Edgbaston, Solihull, Sutton Coldfield and other area's should be returned.
attributes.additional_details: Edgbaston is the home of Warwickshire county cricket club.

attributes.action: British People who are EU nationals should allowed to vote for Parl. Elections.
attributes.background: All British People should be given an opportunity to vote and stand for parliamentary Elections, just as 53 Commonwealth citizens and Irish Nationals domicile in the UK can. Should a 2nd EU Referendum be invoked all the 27 EU Citizens domicile in the UK should be allowed to vote like Irish nationals
attributes.additional_details:
The rules for the Irish were framed during the last century.
All EU nationals resident in Great Britain can vote for all other elections in the UK.
These EU nationals resident in the UK were not given a right to vote even though they pay taxes. Some of them for decades.

attributes.action: Deputy Prime minister post alongside Primeminister & one of them must be a woman
attributes.background: According to 2011 census the UK population was estimated 31 million men and 32.2 million women. By a women in such a key post by law will bring equality and fairness in politics and businesses - women think, work and decide differently - having women's contribution will enhance government polices.
attributes.additional_details: Out of 650 MPs there are 191 women although their representation is improving, they are still often a long way from getting to the highest posts. Studies at Stanford US and University of Chicago have found that districts served by female legislators are at a distinct advantage over those represented by men. Women are actually more inclined towards more modern leadership, which is collaborative problem-solving, enabling, consultative, and not just trying to assert a kind of hierarchical power.

attributes.action: Cameron should call a state of emergency. The country is divided and in turmoil!
attributes.background: The leave vote was not decisive enough to justify changing all our lives

attributes.action: Create further protection for the UK's Human Rights Act of 1998
attributes.background: The UK's legal human rights are formed from the Human Rights Act of 1998, and was protected informally by our membership of the EU. It is now possible future governments will adapt or remove UK citizens human rights easily if no protection through a 2/3rds parliamentary majority is created.
attributes.additional_details:
The following explains how the Human Rights Act protects rights we all assume we have:

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/human-rights/what-are-human-rights/human-rights-act

And evidence of considerations to remove the act by members of the Government:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/scrapping-the-human-rights-act-will-help-protect-human-rights-attorney-general-says-a6894966.html

Do not allow your rights as individuals in the UK to be lost because the UK has left the EU.

attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship automatically to foreign parents of British children
attributes.background:
I am Hungarian, business owner, property owner, a UK resident, have 2 British children, born in the UK.
I want the government to give me and other parents a guarantee, that after leaving the EU, I will have the right to remain, with my family by giving citizenship to parents like me, automatically.
